japaneseNames: モンブラン・ノーランド

keyMoments.description: Reconciles with Kalgara when the truth about Tree Fever is revealed, restoring their friendship
keyMoments.significance: Resolves the central conflict and cements the bond that will echo across 400 years

keyMoments.description: Makes a tearful promise to Kalgara to return to Jaya as the ship departs
keyMoments.significance: Creates the unfulfilled promise that drives the Skypiea Arc's emotional core

keyMoments.description: Returns to Jaya with King Aruyutayan V only to find Shandora has vanished
keyMoments.significance: The moment that seals Noland's fate and creates the 'Liar Noland' legend

keyMoments.description: Publicly executed in Lvneel Kingdom while maintaining his truthfulness about the City of Gold
keyMoments.significance: Noland dies as a supposed liar, creating a 400-year quest to restore his honor

reveals.content: Noland's crew cut down the Forest of Embodiment to save the island from Tree Fever, not from disrespect
Noland returned to Jaya five years after his first visit with King Aruyutayan V
Noland was executed on May 21, 1127 for allegedly lying about the City of Gold
A false crew member testified against Noland while his real crew was silenced by the king

relationships.description: Deep friendship forged across cultural divides, with a promise to reunite that was never fulfilled
The greedy king who executed Noland to cover his own embarrassment
Kalgara's daughter whom Noland saved from being sacrificed to cure the plague

personality: Fearless and composed in dangerous situations
Scientific and rational thinker
Unwavering in his principles and truth
Compassionate toward those suffering
Can be impulsive when acting on scientific knowledge

keyMoments.description: Learns the truth about Tree Fever from his daughter Mousse and rushes to apologize to Noland
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates his ability to admit error and value friendship over pride

keyMoments.description: Vows to ring the Golden Bell every day so Noland can always find his way back to Jaya
keyMoments.significance: Creates the promise that becomes a 400-year quest for the Shandia people

keyMoments.description: Dies in battle against Skypieans while desperately wishing to ring the bell for Noland one last time
keyMoments.significance: Kalgara's unfulfilled wish becomes the driving force for Wyper's quest

reveals.content: Kalgara values friendship enough to overcome cultural pride and apologize for his mistake
Kalgara died fighting the Skypieans after the Knock Up Stream sent Jaya to the sky
Kalgara's dying wish to ring the bell for Noland became a sacred mission for all Shandia descendants

relationships.description: Best friend whose promise to reunite was broken by fate
Daughter who helped reveal the truth about Noland's actions
Descendant who inherits Kalgara's will to ring the bell

personality: Fierce and protective of his people
Initially bound by tradition and superstition
Evolved to value friendship and truth over rigid beliefs
Deeply loyal to promises and commitments
Willing to admit mistakes and seek forgiveness

keyMoments.description: Accompanies Noland to Jaya seeking the City of Gold but finds only jungle
keyMoments.significance: The king's greed leads him to bring his army instead of Noland's experienced crew

keyMoments.description: Orders Noland's execution and silences his real crew to cover his embarrassment
keyMoments.significance: Creates the 'Liar Noland' legend to protect his own reputation

reveals.content: Aruyutayan V was a greedy and selfish king willing to execute an innocent man to save face
The king used a false crew member to testify against Noland while suppressing the truth

relationships.description: Executed Noland despite knowing the explorer was likely telling the truth

personality: Greedy and materialistic
Selfish and willing to sacrifice others for his reputation
Ignorant of the challenges of seafaring
Quick to make rash decisions for personal gain

debut.context: Introduced in Noland flashback as Kalgara's daughter

keyMoments.description: Discovers that the trees Noland cut down were infected with Tree Fever
keyMoments.significance: Mousse's discovery resolves the conflict between Noland and the Shandians

keyMoments.description: Reveals the truth to her father Kalgara, leading to reconciliation with Noland
keyMoments.significance: Acts as the voice of reason and scientific understanding

reveals.content: Mousse has the intelligence and courage to investigate the truth about Tree Fever
Serves as the mediator between traditional Shandia beliefs and Noland's scientific knowledge

relationships.description: Daughter of Kalgara, saved from sacrifice by Noland
Understands and appreciates Noland's efforts to save the Shandia

personality: Intelligent and observant
Open to new ideas and scientific explanations
Acts as voice of reason within traditional society
Brave enough to challenge her father's assumptions

debut.context: Introduced as Shandia warrior in present day Skypiea

keyMoments.description: Young Wyper learns from the Shandia chief about Kalgara's unfulfilled promise to ring the bell for Noland
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the true motivation behind Wyper's relentless fight to reclaim Shandora

reveals.content: Wyper's drive to ring the Golden Bell stems from wanting to fulfill Kalgara's 400-year-old promise
As a child, Wyper was told they must ring the bell so Noland can hear it from heaven
Wyper carries the inherited will of his ancestor Kalgara

relationships.description: Direct descendant who inherited Kalgara's mission and will

personality: Driven by ancestral duty and honor
Determined to fulfill promises made by previous generations
Carries the weight of 400 years of unfulfilled wishes
